question_text: Why might a USB to Ethernet adapter not function on a freshly installed operating system?
answer_options: The USB port must be set to analog mode
The adapter requires a driver that may not be pre-installed
Ethernet over USB must be enabled in BIOS
The adapter requires VGA passthrough to initialize
correct_answer: The adapter requires a driver that may not be pre-installed
explanation: USB to Ethernet adapters often require drivers that are not bundled with fresh OS installations. Without drivers, the adapter cannot initialize.
